main_definition: A central figure in Christianity, regarded as the Son of God and savior by Christians.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Reference to Jesus Christ or his teachings within various contexts.
meanings_and_examples.example: She prayed with a heart full of faith for Jesus.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Joke about an unexpected, often surprising outcome similar to the phrase 'knock on wood'.
meanings_and_examples.example: He said if I tell this joke in class we'll surely get the principal to knock on Jesus!

meanings_and_examples.definition: Expressing surprise or disbelief while hoping for a positive outcome, similar to saying 'break a leg.'
meanings_and_examples.example: When you perform your first solo concert, break a leg! Knock on Jesus if it doesn't go well.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Expressing an intensified form of the phrase 'knock on wood'.
meanings_and_examples.example: Please knock on Jesus; I just saw my reflection and didn't like what I saw!
